abstract_summ: In the absence of a vaccine and effective antiviral medications, most of the non-pharmaceutical interventions focus on reducing social contact rates through different social distancing policies.To assess the change in COVID-19 case counts following the protests, we employ a differences in differences estimation strategy in a multivariate setting, in which we control for social distancing restrictions and social mobility across counties.Our findings have important implications on the magnitude of the testing capacity the City needs as it relaxes the social distancing measures to reopen its economy.Here, we quantify the spread rate of COVID19 before and after national social distancing measures were implemented in 26 nations and compare this to the changes in COVID19 spread rate over equivalent time periods in 27 nations that did not enact social distancing policies.The observed effect cannot be explained by changes in social distancing restrictions and social mobility, and placebo tests rule out the possibility that this finding is attributable to chance.
title_summ: Has Merely Stabilized COVID-19 in the USEffects of Government Mandated Social Distancing Measures on Cumulative Incidence of COVID-19 in the United States and its Most Populated CitiesImpact of relaxing Covid-19 social distancing measures on rural North Wales: a simulation analysisSocial Distancing is Effective at Mitigating COVID-19 Transmission in the United StatesSocial distancing to slow the U.S. COVID-19 epidemic: an interrupted time-series analysisCan Testing Ease Social Distancing Measures?Social Distancing Causally Impacts the Spread of SARS-CoV-2: A U.S. Nationwide Event StudyEnacting national social distancing policies corresponds with dramatic reduction in COVID19 infection ratesThe Immediate Effect of COVID-19 Policies on Social Distancing Behavior in the United StatesPandemic Politics:Strong Social Distancing Measures In The United States Reduced The COVID-19 Growth Rate.Future Evolution of COVID-19 in NYCQuantifying Projected Impact of Social Distancing Policies on COVID-19 Outcomes in the USU.S. county level analysis to determine If social distancing slowed the spread of COVID-19Timing State-Level Social Distancing Responses to COVID-19Social Distancing
title_abstract_phrases: The Immediate Effect of COVID-19 Policies on Social Distancing Behavior in the United StatesIn the absence of a vaccine and effective antiviral medications, most of the non-pharmaceutical interventions focus on reducing social contact rates through different social distancing policies.To assess the change in COVID-19 case counts following the protests, we employ a differences in differences estimation strategy in a multivariate setting, in which we control for social distancing restrictions and social mobility across counties.The observed effect cannot be explained by changes in social distancing restrictions and social mobility, and placebo tests rule out the possibility that this finding is attributable to chance.Here, we quantify the spread rate of COVID19 before and after national social distancing measures were implemented in 26 nations and compare this to the changes in COVID19 spread rate over equivalent time periods in 27 nations that did not enact social distancing policies.Holding the amount of voluntary social distancing constant, these results imply 10 times greater spread by April 27 without SIPOs (10 million cases) and more than 35 times greater spread without any of the four measures (35 million).
